Articles.Content:
<p><img alt="image" src="http://media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_mw4kogkPU61rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img alt="image" src="http://media.tumblr.com/ab283faa256fcc9355fa171c76b5587a/tumblr_inline_mw4knwVeBX1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p>Any fans of retro sci-fi aesthetic in the house? <strong><a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24906-WIP-LLL-Lack-Luster-Labs-Latest-version-0-10-6-for-KSP-0-22-x">Lack Luster Labs</a></strong> is the mod for you!</p>

<p>Relive the days of Buck Rogers and Space: 1999 with this really cool pack of parts that will give your spacecraft just the right look to fit in with the sci-fi imagery of yore.</p>
That ship looks a lot like the Cygnus from Black Hole
About time this one gets some attention!

Cool, one of my favourite parts pack!

I love this one because of its '70s look. It feels like going back to my childhood when I was drooling over books covers done by Chris Foss and other artists.

(Chris Foss fanboy here! ).

Nice to see this pack get some attention!
I love this part pack. I guess I never thought about it like "science fiction," but I guess that's what it looks like! I love the nuclear engines included.

Very cool ship. I've never build anything that big and impressive. How do you get it into orbit? Do you launch it in one piece (hard to imagine), do you construct it in orbit or do you simply just hack it up there.

<snip>

I was wondering the same thing. The ship looks symmetrical, so it should be possible to get it into orbit in one piece. But the size of a lifter that could take all that stuff into orbit scares me....

I'll bet it was hacked into space.

Ooh, well isn't this a nice surprise. Made my day, thank you.

I was wondering the same thing. The ship looks symmetrical, so it should be possible to get it into orbit in one piece. But the size of a lifter that could take all that stuff into orbit scares me....

I'll bet it was hacked into space.

If I remember, hoojiwana said the whole thing was so crushingly laggy that it had to be hyper-editted up.
You can build some nice function and good looking rockets with this. I love LLL.

I was wondering the same thing. The ship looks symmetrical, so it should be possible to get it into orbit in one piece. But the size of a lifter that could take all that stuff into orbit scares me....

I'll bet it was hacked into space.

Nah...check out the Orion Pulse Engine (LINK)

Its a pretty fun mod, but feels like cheating when you can lift a small city into orbit with it...
